body.head.byline: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

abstract.p: Five Days column; Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co agreed to pay nearly $27 billion for First Data Corp; Kohlberg Kravis dropped out of bidding for J Sainsbury, British grocery chain; was locked in struggle with other potential suitors for Alliance Boots, chain of British health and beauty stores (S)

block.p: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company, the private equity firm, agreed to pay nearly $27 billion for the First Data Corporation in one of the largest buyout offers so far this year. Under the terms of the deal, shareholders in First Data, a credit card processor, would receive $34 a share in cash, a 26 percent premium.

One of the largest buyout firms, Kohlberg Kravis has led a string of notable deal offers. Along with the Texas Pacific Group, it has bid $44.4 billion for the Texas energy giant TXU, the largest leveraged buyout offer ever.

In Britain, Kohlberg Kravis dropped out of the bidding for J Sainsbury, the grocery giant, on Thursday, but it is locked in a struggle with other potential suitors for Alliance Boots, a chain of health and beauty stores.

Deal making by Kohlberg Kravis may not be finished. It is part of a consortium that may challenge a $16 billion deal for the Coles Group, the supermarket giant in Australia. That bid is led by Wesfarmers, a big home improvement retailer.
